snippet: The Civilian Complaint Review Board found that in cases in which a driver or passenger was searched, officers failed to file required forms more than half of the time.
abstract: Civilian Complaint Review Board finds that in cases in which driver or passenger is searched during traffic stops, New York City Police Officers fail to file required forms more than half the time; department issued more than a million tickets in 2013 for vehicle infractions, but unlike stop-and-frisk encounters with pedestrians, officers do not collect data on car stops in which no summons is issued.
lead_paragraph: The Civilian Complaint Review Board found that in cases in which a driver or passenger was searched, officers failed to file required forms more than half of the time.

headline.main: Review Finds Police Failure to Report Driver Friskings
headline.print_headline: Friskings of Drivers Unreported, Review Finds
